title: Insight Configuration
description: A configuration defines permissions, layout, data model and actions for one specific use case/scenario (e.g. stocktaking, work planning or work confirmation).

sections.description:
Sections can be used for grouping attributes of one node in the detail view.
- Attributes of one node are listed in the configured order.
- Each attribute can be assigned to a section
- Sections are presented in the configured order
- Section attributes are listed in the order configured in the attributes array
- Sections are displayed in a responsive way (one column or two columns depending on display resolution)
- Sections can be reused in every detail view of one Insight Config configuration

dnd.description:
Insight Explorer offers drag and drop functionality in three different scenarios
- Tree node item to text/input field: copies label of the node item to the field
- Tree node item to foreign key/key field: copies the key into the field (e.g. type of node item is Location. The drop field is attribute location of type Workorder)
- (Tree internal) from node item 1 to node item 2

The first two options are running out of the box. There is no configuration needed. The third option has to be configured in the top level section of a configuration
